fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth

Interface IPasswordAuthnService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAttachable, IAuthnService
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPlatformAuthnService

    public interface IPasswordAuthnService
extends IAuthnService
    An authentication service, capable of providing access control tickets using either valid user credentials, from information available in HTTP requests, or from serialized tokens.

    Note: implementations should be registered with the OSGi service using the IAuthnService interface (this does not prevent registration using other interfaces).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ITicket authenticate(String userPrincipal, char[] userPassword)
      Authenticates a user, using a principal and a password.

      • Methods inherited from interface fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.IAuthnService

        authenticate, getTicketFor, getTicketKey

      • Methods inherited from interface fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.IAttachable

        getAttachId, getAttachVersion

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        ITicket authenticate(String userPrincipal,
                     char[] userPassword)
        Authenticates a user, using a principal and a password. In most cases, this is the preferred method, as the user can be located in a user directory and the password verified in a single operation.

        Note: for security reasons, the password must be specified as a char[] (and not as a String) to improve protection of user credentials. The authentication service should overwrite all characters in the password array as soon as it has been used, to reduce the risk of malicious third-party software retrieving it using memory-scanning techniques.

        Parameters:
        userPrincipal - user's login identifier.
        userPassword - the user's password. DO NOT STORE OR TRY TO RE-USE THIS!
        Returns:
        a ticket for the matching user, if authentication succeeds, or null. Failure causes are not revealed (for security reasons).
        Since:
        1.0
